climbs.name: Open Project
climbs.fa: projected by Russ Walling, Kevin Calder, Rick Cashner 10/97

content.description: The crux is yet to be found, but stellar climbing leads up past 3 bolts.  I sold this route and all the hardware on it to Kevin Calder for $6.00 and a pint of Double Nut Brown ale.  Maybe he will sell it to you?
content.location: This is the overhanging face on the south west side.  Can't miss it.

climbs.name: Jungle / @!%*& Me Up The  @$$ And It Was Great!

content.description: This evolving route features some nice pulls on some quasi permanent flakes.  A few hard pulls will get you off the ground and into some nice climbing.  It climbs steeper than it looks.
content.location: On the east face, this route is just right of the big boulder that sits in the middle of the formation.

content.description: This was the first route put up on the boulder. Interesting moves lead to a balancy crux at mid-height. This one climbs a lot like a Joshua Tree route, in that there are odd moves, painful crimps, a critical smear and some grains.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Lower off anchors at the top of the route.
content.location: This is the left hand route on the east face.
